message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.IR 

This paper deals with activity recognition in videos, which is a classic problem in computer vision. The paper proposes an unsupervised method for recognizing activities in videos using non-parametric Bayesian methods. The paper also proposes a hybrid sampling method to compute compact pattern representations. Given the focus on computer vision and machine learning techniques, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves learning coupled spatial and temporal patterns, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also involves interpreting the semantics of activities, which suggests that it could belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper involves analyzing crowd activity, which suggests that it could belong to cs.MM (Multimedia) or cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
